page.title: 11Peat Cutting, Wick
page.content: Every year,in May or June, families spend weekends at the peat banks on Newton Hill, outside Wick. Peat cutting is a difficult task. Firstly you have to mark out the land where you are cutting. Next you have to take the top,which usually consists of heather,off the bank.After that you are ready to cut your first peat. Many people still use hand tools like a tusker or spade with a small tooth on the end to mark the thickness of each peat. It is necessary to cut large peats because when they are drying they shrink.
